content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast cancer - mixed tubular/cribriform carcinoma, Grade 1, pT2N0M0 (Stage IIA)
	ER 95%, PR 90%, HER2 2+ (FISH negative)
	Diagnosed March 2024

I reviewed [redacted name] today for assessment during her adjuvant chemotherapy. She underwent left wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy on 15/3/24, followed by completion axillary dissection on 28/3/24 after finding a positive sentinel node on frozen section. Final histology showed a 2.8cm Grade 1 mixed tubular/cribriform carcinoma with 1/4 positive sentinel nodes but 0/12 additional nodes on completion dissection.

She is currently receiving adjuvant FEC chemotherapy and has completed 2 cycles. The first cycle was complicated by grade 2 neutropenia requiring a 5-day delay to cycle 2, but otherwise she has managed well with only grade 1 nausea and mild fatigue. Her surgical wounds have healed well with no evidence of lymphoedema. She continues gentle arm exercises as advised by the physiotherapist.

On examination today there is no evidence of local recurrence. The left breast surgical site shows expected post-operative changes. There is good shoulder movement and no axillary lymphadenopathy.

Blood results show recovery of neutrophils to 1.8 and normal liver function. The plan is to proceed with cycle 3 FEC today at 100% doses with primary GCSF prophylaxis. We will review again before cycle 4, with cardiac MUGA scan booked prior to switching to Docetaxel. Following chemotherapy she will proceed to adjuvant radiotherapy and then start endocrine therapy with Letrozole.

I have prescribed antiemetics and provided written information about GCSF administration. [redacted name] understands to contact the acute oncology service if she develops fever or other concerning symptoms.

cancer_timeline.value: Left wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
1/4 positive sentinel nodes on frozen section
Cycle 2 delayed by 5 days due to grade 2 neutropenia

patient_facts.value: No evidence of local recurrence, expected post-operative changes, good shoulder movement, no axillary lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Early stage breast cancer post-surgery, currently receiving adjuvant FEC chemotherapy with initial neutropenia but otherwise good tolerance
Grade 2 neutropenia with first cycle, grade 1 nausea
Proceeding with cycle 3 FEC at 100% doses with primary GCSF prophylaxis
Cardiac MUGA scan before switching to Docetaxel
